patient_info: Facial edema,Impaired social interactions,Apathy,Hypothyroidism,Increased circulating prolactin concentration,Hyperpigmentation of the skin,Papilledema,Cirrhosis,Hepatosplenomegaly,Ascites,Pericardial effusion,Splenomegaly,Anemia,Fever,Dyspnea,Pleural effusion,Lymphadenopathy,Hypoproteinemia,Abdominal distention,EMG abnormality,Upper limb muscle weakness,Decreased body weight,Poor appetite,Abnormal intervertebral disk morphology,Anomalous splenoportal venous system,Foot dorsiflexor weakness,Pedal edema,Anasarca,Lower limb pain,Dysesthesia,Abnormal circulating thyroid hormone concentration,Monoclonal elevation of IgG
golden_diagnosis: POEMS 综合征/POEMS syndrome/POEMS syndrome,POEMS 综合征/POEMS syndrome/POEMS syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Lupus erythematosus (a chronic autoimmune disease that can cause facial edema, impaired social interactions, apathy, and hypothyroidism)
2. congenital aganglionic megacolon (a rare genetic disorder characterized by abdominal distension, lymphadenopathy, and foot dorsiflexor weakness)
3. primary biliary cholangitis (an inflammatory condition of the bile ducts that can cause increased circulating prolactin concentration, hypoproteinemia, and splenomegaly)
4. neuroendocrine tumor (a type of cancer that can produce hormones and can cause various symptoms such as fever, dyspnea, and pericardial effusion)
5. congenital adrenal hyperplasia (a genetic disorder that can cause hypertension, heart failure, and hypothyroidism)
6. multiple sclerosis (a chronic autoimmune disease that can cause muscle weakness, EMG abnormality, and fatigue)
7. rhabdomyolysis (a condition characterized by muscle breakdown and release of muscle contents into the bloodstream, which can cause anemia, fever, and dyspnea)
8. Goodpasture's disease (an autoimmune disorder that affects the blood vessels in the skin and internal organs, leading to hypothyroidism, apathy, and foot dorsiflexor weakness)
9. Fabry disease (a rare inherited disorder that affects the body's ability to produce the enzyme acid alpha-glucosidase, leading to increased circulating prolactin concentration, hypoproteinemia, and pericardial effusion)
10. hereditary angioedema (a genetic disorder that can cause facial edema, lymphadenopathy, and foot dorsiflexor weakness)
